Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery open vessel, possibly a column-krater; interior glazed black; exterior: chariot scene (heads of chariot team with added red on manes, added white on teeth and studs on reins) to right.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 283, no. B249)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0163) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 96, pl. III, no. 9)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
